required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects of L-arabinose in a Meal in Healthy Men
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of L-arabinose in a Meal on Glucose Metabolism in Healthy Men

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the effect of a meal containing different doses of L-arabinose, on the intestinal sucrase activity after intake We measure this by measuring the glucose, insulin and c-peptide after meals. Other measurements are made (glucagon and GLP-1) to explain the correlations.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Prevention

primary_outcome.description: Level of glucose over time, The AUC, the peak value and time to peak
Level of insulin over time, the AUC, the peak value and time to peak
Level of c-peptide over time, The AUC, the peak value and time to peak

secondary_outcome.description: Level of glucagon over time, The AUC, the peak value and time to peak
Level of GLP-1 over time, The AUC, the peak value and time to peak

arm_group.description: A meal containing a bon with butter and marmalade, a cup cake, The and water
A meal containing a bon with butter and marmalade, a cup cake, The and water
A meal containing a bon with butter and marmalade, a cup cake, The and water
A meal containing two bons with butter and cheese, The and water
A meal containing two bons with butter and cheese, The and water
A meal containing two bons with butter and cheese, The and water

intervention.description: L-arabinose is mixed into the dough of the buns and cup cakes

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy male
- normal weight (BMI 18,5-25 kg/m2)
- 18-30 years of age
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not healthy,including those with diabetes Mellitus, high bloodpressure, dyslipidemia or a infectious diseases (hepatitis or HIV), gastrointestinal disorders
- Central adipositas (defined as waist circumference > 94 cm for european men)
- Daily intake of vitamins and minerals, 3 months before the trail starts and during the trail.
- elevated alcoholcunsumption(> 21 units af alcohol pr. week)
- take medicine
- Elite athlete with intensive training
- given bloddonation within the last 3 months
- smoking

overall_official.affiliation: Unit of Nutrition 5711, Rigshospitalet, Blegdamsvej 9, 2100 København Ø
